meanings.definition: Relating to the study and classification of people according to their attitudes, aspirations, and other psychological criteria.
meanings.sent1: The marketing team used psychographic data to understand the preferences of their customers.
meanings.sent2: Companies often create psychographic profiles to target specific consumer groups.
meanings.sent3: It was a psychographic puzzle trying to figure out what made the customers tick.
meanings.sent4: Her psychographic analysis of the audience's behavior was spot on.
meanings.sent5: The colorful charts made the psychographic information easy to grasp.

meanings.definition: A characteristic of a particular group of people based on their psychological traits and behaviors.
meanings.sent1: The company identified a psychographic that represented their target market.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the psychographics of the audience helped tailor the advertising campaign.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see how the psychographic of the group influenced their choices.
meanings.sent4: The psychographic of the community painted a vivid picture of their lifestyle.
meanings.sent5: The psychographic data revealed fascinating insights into consumer behavior.
